name: Get That Girl!
description:
"Hi.

I love you."

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Get That Girl! is an interactive fiction about a girl having a crush on her best friend.  The story progresses depending on how you respond to her texts. There are 3 possible endings, so try to get all of them!  (NOTE: If the game doesn't load, try refreshing the page!)

This game was made using Twine 2 for UCSC's CMPM 80K Winter 2018 course.

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

The story for this game was based on my own personal experience as a queer female struggling with unrequited feelings. I wanted to create content that would help people who aren't LGBTQ+ understand what it feels like to fall for someone of the same gender, as well as provide other queer folk a game that would give them visibility.
